titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: We dined with Sir Henry Fowler. Among the company were

, & the Attorney–General. I had some most interesting conversation with both. Morley spoke with much frankness of India, and on Socialism. He thought the Socialist victory in the Colne valley would tell badly for the government in the country.
After the ladies had withdrawn, the talk turned on the recent ecclesiastical appointments, and I took the opportunity of speaking plainly what I thought.
